abstracts.cdata!:
This report is in response to a request
            from the Executive Directors for periodic updates on the
            status of outstanding issues following the Inspection Panel
            Investigation Report and Management's Response to
            issues claimed concerning the India Coal Sector
            Environmental and Social Mitigation Project. This report
            therefore states that although Coal India Ltd. (CIL) and the
            Government of India (GOI) have expressed their willingness
            to act on a number of the outstanding issues, the pace of
            resolution in some cases has been rather slow due to the
            complexity of the issue, and the constraints of the existing
            legal context. This also limits the impacts of the
            Bank's efforts to facilitate desirable resolutions. As
            described in the report, there are a number of issues for
            which Bank supervision has already been terminated (issues 6
            and 9) or which Management now proposes the Bank should no
            longer supervise, either because they are substantially
            resolved (issues 1 and 4) or because there is little
            prospect that further Bank supervision would impact outcomes
            (issues 5 and 7). For the remaining issues - settlement of
            claims for Project affected people (PAP) cultivating land
            under customary tenure (issue 2), provision of long-term
            leases for their house plots in the resettlement area (issue
            3), and mechanisms for consultation and dissemination of
            project related information to PAPs (issue 8) - Management
            proposes to monitor development for a further six months,
            and to intervene if it believes this would help further
            progress. One further supervision mission would be planned.
